Subject: Financial Planning
Description: As much as we might want to avoid it, we're slowing becoming adults with adult responsibilites.  We can all use advice on money management and planning for our future.  Speakers include:Ericka S. Kahler - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Tools for Outlines: M.I.C.E., The Three Act Structure
Description: Is your story about Milieu, an Idea, a Character, or an Event? Figure out what sort of story you want to tell, and see which elements are most important, how you might want to structure the story, and how to tell if you've reached the end.   Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Ericka S. Kahler, Eric S. Raymond, Michael K. Elliot, Angie Rush - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Mechanics of Magic in Fantasy & SF
Description: Does a magical system for a story need rules? Costs, unintended consequences, social factors? What about reliability issues? How can we avoid worn-out tropes. How should magic in an RPG and story differ? Is some of the tech in SF 'magic' and should the same considerations apply?  Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Ericka S. Kahler, Eric S. Raymond, Cathrynne Valente, Andrew Zimmerman Jones - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Teens of the Wasteland
Description: Why do so many contemporary YA novels feature a post-apocalyptic setting with teens on a journey across what remains of civilization? What needs to these books fulfill, and has the wave of their popularity already peaked? If so, whatâ€™s next?  Speakers include:Emmy Jackson, Jon David, Ericka S. Kahler, Janice Leach, Angie Rush - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
